vulnerable_road_users.description: On the left side of the sidewalk, a few pedestrians can be seen, one of whom appears to be close to the curb.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Self-driving vehicles must monitor these pedestrians to ensure they don't accidentally wander onto the roadway.

traffic lights.description: A traffic signal displaying a green light is visible ahead.
traffic lights.explanation: The vehicle can continue to drive, but should pay attention to changes in traffic signals and other road users who may affect its right of way.

barriers.description: Temporary traffic barriers have been set up on the right side of the road, in relation to the work area indicated by cone-shaped signs.
barriers.explanation: Obstacles indicate that private cars need to keep to the left and maintain a safe distance from the construction site.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the observed traffic image, there are a few pedestrians on the left side of the sidewalk, with one pedestrian particularly close to the curb. Autonomous vehicles should track their movement to prevent potential hazards should any of them step onto the road unintentionally.

Additionally, there is a traffic light ahead showing a green signal, permitting the vehicle to proceed. Despite the go-ahead, the vehicle must remain vigilant for any sudden shifts in the traffic lights or unexpected actions from other road users which might impact its priority on the road.

Also notable are the temporary traffic barriers installed on the right side of the road. These are associated with a construction zone, as indicated by nearby cone-shaped signs, and suggest that vehicles, including self-driving cars, should remain on the left and keep a safe distance from the work area to avoid incidents.

driving_suggestion: Drive carefully and maintain a speed suitable for nighttime driving. Keep to the left and stay away from work areas delineated by fences. Be prepared to stop or adjust your speed if traffic conditions change or pedestrians enter the roadway. Keep a safe following distance from the vehicle ahead and be aware that the current green traffic light may change, affecting the right of way.

1.description and explanation: The object is a pedestrian standing by the side of the road. Pedestrians are individuals walking on foot and might cross streets, walk along sidewalks or road edges, and may enter traffic unexpectedly. The presence of a pedestrian influences the ego car's driving behavior by necessitating vigilance, readiness to stop, adherence to pedestrian right-of-way laws, and often slowing down when in areas with high pedestrian traffic or when pedestrians appear to be preparing to cross the road.

2.description and explanation: A human standing by the road. This figure warrants caution, as they may intend to cross the street or may enter the roadway unexpectedly. The ego car should reduce speed and be prepared to stop to ensure the safety of the pedestrian.
